conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric view: walls have clear vertical height and thickness, rooms read as volumetric spaces, multiple wall faces (top/side) are visible, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with consistent wall thickness, readable room volumes, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification at some corners/openings and slightly soft edges reduce geometric crispness.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: two bedrooms, central bath, kitchen/dining/living zone, and corridor/entry structure are present with correct general adjacencies. Some proportional and partition details appear slightly shifted/simplified (notably around closet/entry and a few interior wall breaks), and several openings are less exact than the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present (beds, sofa, dining table, kitchen counters/island, tub/toilet/sink). Placement generally aligns with intended rooms; a few elements look simplified and slightly oversized/undersized relative to tight areas.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation on a plain background with no UI/text contamination in the 3D render. Geometry is readable; lighting is somewhat flat/soft, slightly reducing edge definition of openings and wall junctions.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion deviations and simplification of some internal partitions compared with the 2D plan (especially near entry/closet/corridor transitions).
Some door/opening placements and sizes appear approximated rather than matching the 2D plan exactly (door swing/detail fidelity reduced).
Soft lighting/material contrast slightly reduces clarity of wall edges and opening geometry.

summary: A clear, true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and furnishing, with only minor proportional/partition and opening-detail mismatches versus the 2D plan.
